import {useEffect} from 'react'; import xIcon from '../img/close.png'; export default function (props) { useEffect(() => { document.addEventListener('keydown', detectKeyDown, true) }, []) const detectKeyDown = (e) => { props.setAuthenticated(true); } return (
EXPERIENCE.txt
Meta | Software Engineer Intern
-Full Stack Software Engineering Intern in Meta's Menlo Park office working on the Quick Promotion Campaign Studio team using technologies such as React, Hack (PHP), and GraphQL
Amazon | Software Development Engineer Intern
-Worked in a team of engineers both designing scalable systems and implementing them to create a service automating work authorization, a previously manual process, at Amazon
-Used various technologies, such Lambda Functions, Step Funcions, Event bridge, Redshift, S3, and other AWS services as well as languages like Typescript and Java
Nasdaq | Software Engineer Fellow
-Worked in a team of engineers to develop a homomorphic encryption module, commercializing cutting edge research using Python Flask, Java Springboot, and React allowing users to perform calculations on encrypted data without decrypting it, keeping it secure during the whole process
-Improved the speed of the hibernate security services Java API when dealing with large amounts of users
DIFUSE Lab | Full Stack Software Engineer Intern
-Collaborated with a team to build a React App through the NSF funded DIFUSE project, which analyzes zoom transcripts with NLP and generates insightful visualizations to the user.
-Used and built various APIs, contributed to a React front end and Flask app + MongoDB backend to make the app accessible to both professors and students
) }
